summary: This bill, the Newborn Screening Saves Lives Reauthorization Act of 2025, reauthorizes and amends programs under the Public Health Service Act related to genetic diseases in newborns. It focuses on improving newborn and child screening, follow-up services, and educational programs for families. The bill also updates the responsibilities of the Advisory Committee on Heritable Disorders in Newborns and Children, coordinates national surveillance activities, and provides increased funding for research and screening programs. It also addresses issues related to institutional review boards reviewing dried blood spots for newborn screening.
